official-title.#text:
To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 in order to allow the Secretary of Education to award job
			 training Federal Pell Grants.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Education and the Workforce

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Jumpstart Our Businesses by Supporting Students Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Jumpstart Our Businesses by Supporting Students Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end
			 the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 401 of the Higher Education Act of 1965

header.#text: Job training Federal Pell Grant program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 carry out a program through which the

awards job training
			 Federal Pell Grants to students in job training programs. Each job
			 training Federal Pell Grant awarded under this subsection shall have the
			 same terms and conditions, and be awarded in the same manner, as a Federal
			 Pell Grant awarded under

text.#text: For the award years beginning on July 1, 2014, and ending on June 30, 2020, the

A student who is eligible to receive a job training Federal Pell Grant under this subsection is a
			 student who—
has not yet attained a baccalaureate degree or postbaccalaureate degree;
attends an eligible institution of higher education;

is enrolled in, or accepted for enrollment in, a job training program at such institution of higher
			 education that does not lead to a baccalaureate degree; and

meets all other eligibility requirements for a Federal Pell Grant (except with respect to the type
			 of program of study, as provided in
The amount of a job training Federal Pell Grant for an eligible student shall be determined under
the maximum Federal Pell Grant for purposes of an award under this subsection shall be $2,430;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for a student receiving a job training
			 Federal Pell Grant under this subsection; and

text.#text: no increase shall be calculated under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
prohibiting Federal Pell Grants of less than a certain amount
			 shall not apply.

text.#text: the requirement of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, and any regulations under such
			 subsection regarding students who are enrolled in an undergraduate program
			 on less than a full-time basis shall similarly apply to students who are
			 enrolled in a job training program at an eligible institution on less than
			 a full-time basis.

text.#text:
Any period during which a student receives a job training Federal Pell Grant under this subsection
			 shall be included in calculating the student's period of eligibility for
			 Federal Pell Grants under

term.#tail: means a career and technical education program at an institution of higher education that—

text.#text: In this subsection, the term

provides not less than 150 clock hours of instructional time over a period of not less than 8
			 weeks;
provides training needed to meet the needs of the local or regional workforce;

provides a student, upon completion of the program, with a recognized educational credential that
			 is recognized by the relevant industry and meets the requirements of

has been determined, by the institution of higher education, to provide academic content, an amount
			 of instructional time, and a recognized educational credential that are
			 sufficient to—
meet the hiring requirements of multiple potential employers; and

allow the students to apply for any licenses or certifications that may be required to be employed
			 in the field for which the job training is offered; and
may include integrated or basic skills courses.
